newsArray.title: тАШIтАЩve got no dramasтАЩ: Lyon extends olive branch to Johnson
creator: Daniel Brettig
newsArray.description: Nathan Lyon has extended his hand to Mitchell Johnson ahead of the Perth Test against Pakistan, declaring their bond from the 2013-14 Ashes series is unbroken
newsArray.content: Perth: Nathan Lyon has extended his hand to Mitchell Johnson ahead of the Perth Test against Pakistan, declaring their bond from the 2013-14 Ashes series is unbroken despite the former spearheadтАЩs fiery recent criticism of the Australian team. Still early in his Test career when Johnson rattled England in a 5-0 whitewash , Lyon has since grown into an integral member of the national side and now sits on the cusp of becoming only the third Australian to take 500 Test wickets. Mitchell Johnson celebrates with Nathan Lyon after Johnson threw down the stumps to run out Joe Root at the MCG in 2013. Credit: Ken Irwin He is a strong chance to take the four wickets he needs at Perth Stadium starting on Thursday, given that nowhere else in Australia has been more helpful to his art - Lyon has plucked 22 wickets at 18.45 in three Tests at the ground, striking every 42.4 deliveries. And Lyon has no intention of brushing Johnson if they cross paths during Test week, with the left-armer and now commentator to be part of the Triple M team for the match . тАЬIf heтАЩs around the ground IтАЩll say hello to him, IтАЩve got no dramas with saying hello,тАЭ Lyon said. тАЬHe was pretty incredible in that 2013-14 Ashes, and IтАЩve got some very fond memories of it, thatтАЩs for sure. тАЬI feel like this stadium is word class and the facilities weтАЩve had out here have been really exciting to bowl on and be a part of a strong bowling group. тАЬI like playing my role here, I enjoy bowling here, thereтАЩs nice bounce, a bit of spin there on offer as well, so all in all a nice place to bowl.тАЬ Nevertheless, Lyon politely rejected the notion that the team led by Pat Cummins needed to move into regeneration mode this summer, the subject of JohnsonтАЩs most recent column. WA speedster Lance Morris is likely to remain in the wings as Cummins, Mitch Starc and Josh Hazlewood form the frontline pace trio, with Lyon to replace Todd Murphy in the XI that finished the Ashes. тАЬYou look at the squad weтАЩve got at the moment, yes weтАЩve played a lot of cricket together but weтАЩve won a lot of games together as well,тАЭ he said. тАЬThen you look at the World Cup guys and what theyтАЩve been able to win as a collective, I feel like thatтАЩs incredibly important. тАЬThis is AustraliaтАЩs cricket team and in my eyes you need to pick the best available 11 and I believe that is what the selectors are doing.тАЬ Rejuvenated after missing three Ashes Tests due to a badly torn calf, Lyon is enthused by the prospect of joining Shane Warne and Glenn McGrath in the rarified air of 500-plus Test victims, and he refused to rule out challenging their tallies by the time he finished up. тАЬIтАЩm not putting a number on it,тАЭ Lyon said. тАЬI want to play cricket for as long as I can. I didnтАЩt win in India and I havenтАЩt won in England, and itтАЩs two places I want to do. I feel like thereтАЩs a passion there to keep going - IтАЩm definitely not putting a line through where I can get to. тАЬItтАЩs something IтАЩm extremely proud of and when you look at it youтАЩre slowly creeping your way up on two Australian greats who are the only two guys who have taken over 500 wickets for Australia. ItтАЩs pretty amazing when you potentially see your name up alongside those guys.тАЭ Mitchell Johnson wrestles with Nathan Lyon during training ahead of the 2015 Perth Test. Credit: Paul Kane Lyon took note of how PakistanтАЩs captain Shan Masood and other touring batters aimed to get after the spin of his understudy Todd Murphy in Canberra, albeit in slow and low conditions much closer in character to Pakistan than Perth. тАЬI did watch that, but looking at their batting lineup IтАЩve played against the majority of those guys a number of times now, so I know how I think theyтАЩre going to look to attack me,тАЭ Lyon said. тАЬThe wicket looks like itтАЩll be a typical Perth wicket, even though we are still three days out. ItтАЩs all looking like really good signs compared to Lahore, Karachi and Islamabad [Rawalpindi]. ItтАЩs going to be a bit different.тАЭ

Tags: Gautam gambhir , Legends League Cricket , S Sreesanth рдЕрдм рдирд╣реАрдВ рд░рдЧрдбрд╝рдирд╛ рдкрдбрд╝реЗрдЧрд╛ рдкреБрд░рд╛рдирд╛ рдлреЛрди, Vivo рд╕реЗ Realme рддрдХ, рдЗрд╕ рд╣рдлреНрддреЗ рд╣реЛрдЧреА рдЗрди рдирдП рд╕реНрдорд╛рд░реНрдЯрдлреЛрди рдХреА рднрд░рдорд╛рд░ рдмрдбрд╝реЗ рдПрдХреНрдЯрд░ рдиреЗ рд░рд┐рдЬреЗрдХреНрдЯ рдХреА 4 рдлрд┐рд▓реНрдореЗрдВ, 1 рд╕реЗ рдЪрдордХреА рд░рдгрдмреАрд░ рдХрдкреВрд░ рдХреА рдХрд┐рд╕реНрдордд, рдЕрдм 2019 рд╕реЗ рдПрдХ HIT рдХреЛ рддрд░рд╕ рд░рд╣рд╛ рдпреЗ рд╣реАрд░реЛ 74 рд╕рд╛рд▓ рдкреБрд░рд╛рдиреА рдлрд┐рд▓реНрдо рдЖрдИ рдЗрддрдиреА рдкрд╕рдВрдж, рдореЗрдХрд░реНрд╕ рдиреЗ 1 рд╣реА рдирд╛рдо рд╕реЗ рдмрдирд╛ рдбрд╛рд▓реА 3 рдФрд░ рдлрд┐рд▓реНрдореЗрдВ, рдмреЙрдХреНрд╕ рдСрдлрд┐рд╕ рд╕реЗ рдХреА рдЫрдкреНрдкрд░ рдлрд╛рдбрд╝ рдХрдорд╛рдИ

newsArray.title: Test cricketer Asad Shafiq retires
creator: Noor Fatima
GNN
newsArray.description: While holding a press conference after the match, he said that there was no pressure to retire.
newsArray.content: Lahore: Test cricketer Asad Shafiq has announced his retirement from international and domestic cricket. According to the details, the middle-order batsman was also presented with a guard of honor by fellow players at the end of the national T20. While holding a press conference after the match, he said that there was no pressure to retire. Misbah-ul-Haq was the best captain. The right-handed batsman stated that the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) offered to join the selection committee, feeling lucky to have represented Pakistan in all three formats. Asad Shafiq represented Pakistan in all three formats, playing 77 Tests, 60 One Day Internationals (ODIs) and 10 T20Is.

newsArray.description:
Sunil Gavaskar On South Africa Cricket Board: рднрд╛рд░рдд рдФрд░ рджрдХреНрд╖рд┐рдг рдЕрдлреНрд░реАрдХрд╛ рдХреЗ рдмреАрдЪ рдЯреА20 рд╕реАрд░реАрдЬрд╝ рдХрд╛ рдкрд╣рд▓рд╛ рдореБрдХрд╛рдмрд▓рд╛ рдмрд╛рд░рд┐рд╢ рдХреЗ рдЪрд▓рддреЗ рд░рджреНрдж рд╣реЛ рдЧрдпрд╛. рджреЛрдиреЛрдВ рдХреЗ рдмреАрдЪ рдкрд╣рд▓рд╛ рдореБрдХрд╛рдмрд▓рд╛ рдмреАрддреЗ рд░рд╡рд┐рд╡рд╛рд░ (10 рджрд┐рд╕рдВрдмрд░) рдбрд░рдмрди рдореЗрдВ рдЦреЗрд▓рд╛ рдЬрд╛рдирд╛ рдерд╛, рд▓реЗрдХрд┐рди рдмрд╛рд░рд┐рд╢ рдХреЗ рдЪрд▓рддреЗ рдореБрдХрд╛рдмрд▓реЗ рдХреЗ рд▓рд┐рдП рдЯреЙрд╕ рддрдХ рди рд╣реЛ рд╕рдХрд╛. рдЕрдм рднрд╛рд░рдд рдФрд░ рджрдХреНрд╖рд┐рдг рдЕрдлреНрд░реАрдХрд╛ рдХреЗ рдмреАрдЪ рдкрд╣рд▓рд╛ рдЯреА20 рдмрд╛рд░рд┐рд╢ рдХреЗ рдХрд╛рд░рдг рд░рджреНрдж рд╣реЛрдиреЗ рдкрд░ рд╕реБрдиреАрд▓ рдЧрд╛рд╡рд╕реНрдХрд░ рднрдбрд╝рдХ рдЙрдареЗ. рдЙрдиреНрд╣реЛрдВрдиреЗ рджрдХреНрд╖рд┐рдг рдЕрдлреНрд░реАрдХрд╛ рдХреНрд░рд┐рдХреЗрдЯ рдмреЛрд░реНрдб рдХреА рдЬрдордХрд░ рдЖрд▓реЛрдЪрдирд╛ рдХреА.

newsArray.title: Yashasvi Jaiswal is an all-format prospect for India, says Sunil Gavaskar
newsArray.description: Yashasvi Jaiswal is an all-format prospect for India, says Sunil Gavaskar
newsArray.content: Listen to Story Legendary India batter Sunil Gavaskar has heaped praise on young India opener Yashasvi Jaiswal, calling him an all-format prospect. IndiaтАЩs opening match of their month-long tour to South Africa was on Sunday, December 10. Jaiswal broke into the Indian team following an impressive campaign in the 2023 Indian Premier League, where he scored 625 runs in 14 matches. Jaiswal's strike rate in 2023 was 163.61, while his strike rates in the previous two seasons were 132.99 and 148.21 in 2022 and 2021 respectively. Since making his debut for India, Jaiswal has scored 370 runs in 13 T20Is at an average of 33.63 while striking at 163.71. Incredibly, heтАЩs already scored a century and two half-centuries in T20Is for India. Not so great news from Durban as the 1st T20I has been called off due to incessant rains. тАФ BCCI (@BCCI) Speaking to Star Sports, Gavaskar said Jaiswal has got the boldness of youth, while calling him a very good talent. Jaiswal has made a great start to his India career and will be looking to cement his spot in IndiaтАЩs squad for next yearтАЩs T20 World Cup in the USA and West Indies. тАЬYashasvi Jaiswal is a very good talent and brings the left-handed factor as well. He's got the boldness of youth and freshness of not being tied down by ideas of how one should play,тАЭ said Gavaskar. He went on to call Jaiswal an all-format prospect, adding that he focuses on watching the ball and hitting it. Jaiswal has played two Test matches for India, scoring 266 runs at an average of 88.66, while hitting a century and a half-century. тАЬJust see the ball and hit the ball, this is what he does, and does it so well. He's got a century in Test cricket as well. So he is a good all-format prospect for India,тАЭ Gavaskar added. Following the wash out in Durban, India will get ready to face the Proteas in the second match of the T20I series at St George's Oval in Port Elizabeth on Tuesday, December 12.

newsArray.title: Virat Kohli-Anushka Sharma Wedding Anniversary: Fans Share Wishes for Star Couple On Their Sixth Marriage Anniversary
newsArray.description: The extremely popular couple is often referred to as 'Virushka' by fans. Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma had tied the knot way back in 2017 in Italy. See how fans have wished them on this special day.
newsArray.content: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma--two of the most popular personalities are celebrating their sixth wedding anniversary on December 11, 2023. The couple tied the knot way back in 2017 in a lavish ceremony that was held in Italy and have time and again, never stopped expressing love, respect and admiration for each other in public. The two began dating after their encounter during an advertisement in 2013. Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma also have a daughter named Vamika, who was born in 2021. As the couple enter into six years of marriage, fans have showered wishes for them on social media. 6 years of togetherness & many more to go... newsArray.title: Premier Cricket: Teague Wyllie resolute in return for Rockingham-Mandurah, leads team to win over South Perth
creator: Matt Zis
newsArray.description: Teague WyllieтАЩs first game back from injury came with exactly the innings the talented youngster wanted as he batted Rockingham-Mandurah to victory.
newsArray.content: Teague WyllieтАЩs first game back from injury was exactly the innings the talented youngster needed as he batted Rockingham-Mandurah to victory. Wyllie was left out of WAтАЩs most recent Shield contest against Queensland after injuring his arm. In his return to the crease with Premier Cricket side Rockingham-Mandurah, Wyllie made 72 not out as he anchored the MarinersтАЩ run chase from late on Saturday until they surpassed South PerthтАЩs underwhelming total of 163 the following day. But the success at Richardson Park тАФ set up by Ronan Hogarth and Aaron BurrageтАЩs three-wicket hauls on day one of the clash тАФ was far from a given as the Mariners lost seven wickets in the run chase with alarming regularity. Wyllie was more than up for the challenge, however, despite wickets falling in clumps all around him. He soaked up 229 deliveries and aside from Hogarth, who came in at No.9 and made a brisk 28n.o., was the only MarinersтАЩ batsman to pass 20. Their unbroken 66-run stand saved the day for the Mariners, who had been behind the eight-ball from the time WyllieтАЩs opening partner Mitchell Wagstaff fell for 16 close to stumps on Saturday. WagstaffтАЩs dismissal triggered a run of three wickets for just three runs and from 3-25 early on Sunday it didnтАЩt get a lot better for the visitors. The Burrage brothers fell in quick succession to be 5-58 and then 6-71 when John Sanders was trapped LBW for 8, with the Mariners neededing someone to stand up alongside their teenage tyro. Cooper Clarke-Dehring (20) тАФ and then Hogarth тАФ answered that call, working with Teague to knock off the 100-odd runs their side needed to claim the points. The MarinersтАЩ last game before the Christmas break is a one-dayer against Wanneroo at their Lark Hill home this Saturday.

newsArray.title: тАШHe is really importantтАЩ: Cripps backs favourite son in selection squeeze
creator: Jon Pierik
newsArray.description: Carlton skipper Patrick Cripps says versatility is the key for a third-generation Blue to win senior selection, coming as the superstar midfielder revealed the one word he does not want uttered this season.
newsArray.content: Carlton captain Patrick Cripps says Jack Silvagni can force his way into the BluesтАЩ best 23 next season, but that may depend on Michael VossтАЩ selection philosophy. Silvagni has signed a two-year contract extension to remain at Visy Park , his future a point of debate when ruckman-forward Tom de Koning emerged as an important figure last season, joining star tall forwards Charlie Curnow and Harry McKay, and frontline ruckman Marc Pittonet. The third-generation Blue has been used in a variety of positions through the years, most recently as an undersized back-up ruck, and again faces a major fight to earn regular senior selection. He had a knee injury late last season, which hindered his bid for selection as the Blues made a breakthrough deep finals run, falling just short of the grand final. Selection squeeze: Patrick Cripps has backed Jack Silvagni to force his way into the BluesтАЩ best 23 next season. Credit: Getty Images As the Blues confirmed a three-year sponsorship deal with Ampol on Monday, Cripps said Silvagni still had a lot to offer. тАЬHis role is really important. He plays that hybrid forward. He can play tall, he can play small, his pressure. I think his biggest one wood is the competitive energy that he has,тАЭ Cripps said. тАЬThat second ruck role that he can play as well, as an under-sized player, a bit more mobility around the ground тАУ itтАЩs all up to the coaching staff in terms of if we go two rucks, or we go the hybrid role. I just know what you are going to get when SOS plays. We all love playing with him.тАЭ Silvagni played 16 senior games last season, his last against West Coast in round 19, taking his career tally to 115 since debuting in 2016. The Blues had a strong training session on Monday, Silvagni included, as they aim to deliver the clubтАЩs first grand-final appearance since 1999. Cripps said the clubтАЩs new faces had impressed in the first phase of the pre-season campaign. тАЬThe new boys, Ashton [Moir], Billy [Wilson], Matty [Carroll], they have all fitted in really well and had a crack. Ashton and Billy have done most of the sessions, thatтАЩs all you can ask,тАЭ he said. Loading Voss spoke last week about the heightened expectations the Blues face this season. However, Cripps, 28, said there was one word he did not want uttered in a year when the Blues will be in the spotlight, having become a prime-time favourite of host broadcasters. тАЬI actually hate the word expectations, because you are trying to predict something that hasnтАЩt happened yet,тАЭ Cripps, having averaged almost 25 disposals in 24 games last year, said. тАЬI think we learnt a really hard lesson last year, and I felt like the group lost their confidence in the middle part. I think through that adversity we know what we can focus on to make us a good side тАж the controllables. тАЬThe external, it doesnтАЩt actually really matter. What really matters is what we value internally. We talk about a lot of things without the ball. тАЬThe one thing we really focused on in that back half of the year was how can we bring a lot of joy and fun around the club. ThatтАЩs what I feel like last year, as hard as it was, we learnt a really good lesson about what is important to us. I think thatтАЩs what gives me a lot of confidence going into this pre-season, and also the season тАУ we know what makes us a good side.тАЭ The Blues open the new season against the Lions in Brisbane on March 8. newsArray.title: тАШIтАЩve got no dramasтАЩ: Lyon extends olive branch to Johnson
creator: Daniel Brettig
newsArray.description: Nathan Lyon has extended his hand to Mitchell Johnson ahead of the Perth Test against Pakistan, declaring their bond from the 2013-14 Ashes series is unbroken
newsArray.content: Perth: Nathan Lyon has extended his hand to Mitchell Johnson ahead of the Perth Test against Pakistan, declaring their bond from the 2013-14 Ashes series is unbroken despite the former spearheadтАЩs fiery recent criticism of the Australian team. Still early in his Test career when Johnson rattled England in a 5-0 whitewash , Lyon has since grown into an integral member of the national side and now sits on the cusp of becoming only the third Australian to take 500 Test wickets. Mitchell Johnson celebrates with Nathan Lyon after Johnson threw down the stumps to run out Joe Root at the MCG in 2013. Credit: Ken Irwin He is a strong chance to take the four wickets he needs at Perth Stadium starting on Thursday, given that nowhere else in Australia has been more helpful to his art - Lyon has plucked 22 wickets at 18.45 in three Tests at the ground, striking every 42.4 deliveries. And Lyon has no intention of brushing Johnson if they cross paths during Test week, with the left-armer and now commentator to be part of the Triple M team for the match . тАЬIf heтАЩs around the ground IтАЩll say hello to him, IтАЩve got no dramas with saying hello,тАЭ Lyon said. тАЬHe was pretty incredible in that 2013-14 Ashes, and IтАЩve got some very fond memories of it, thatтАЩs for sure. тАЬI feel like this stadium is word class and the facilities weтАЩve had out here have been really exciting to bowl on and be a part of a strong bowling group. тАЬI like playing my role here, I enjoy bowling here, thereтАЩs nice bounce, a bit of spin there on offer as well, so all in all a nice place to bowl.тАЬ Nevertheless, Lyon politely rejected the notion that the team led by Pat Cummins needed to move into regeneration mode this summer, the subject of JohnsonтАЩs most recent column. WA speedster Lance Morris is likely to remain in the wings as Cummins, Mitch Starc and Josh Hazlewood form the frontline pace trio, with Lyon to replace Todd Murphy in the XI that finished the Ashes. тАЬYou look at the squad weтАЩve got at the moment, yes weтАЩve played a lot of cricket together but weтАЩve won a lot of games together as well,тАЭ he said. тАЬThen you look at the World Cup guys and what theyтАЩve been able to win as a collective, I feel like thatтАЩs incredibly important. тАЬThis is AustraliaтАЩs cricket team and in my eyes you need to pick the best available 11 and I believe that is what the selectors are doing.тАЬ Rejuvenated after missing three Ashes Tests due to a badly torn calf, Lyon is enthused by the prospect of joining Shane Warne and Glenn McGrath in the rarified air of 500-plus Test victims, and he refused to rule out challenging their tallies by the time he finished up. тАЬIтАЩm not putting a number on it,тАЭ Lyon said. тАЬI want to play cricket for as long as I can. I didnтАЩt win in India and I havenтАЩt won in England, and itтАЩs two places I want to do. I feel like thereтАЩs a passion there to keep going - IтАЩm definitely not putting a line through where I can get to. тАЬItтАЩs something IтАЩm extremely proud of and when you look at it youтАЩre slowly creeping your way up on two Australian greats who are the only two guys who have taken over 500 wickets for Australia. ItтАЩs pretty amazing when you potentially see your name up alongside those guys.тАЭ Mitchell Johnson wrestles with Nathan Lyon during training ahead of the 2015 Perth Test. Credit: Paul Kane Lyon took note of how PakistanтАЩs captain Shan Masood and other touring batters aimed to get after the spin of his understudy Todd Murphy in Canberra, albeit in slow and low conditions much closer in character to Pakistan than Perth. тАЬI did watch that, but looking at their batting lineup IтАЩve played against the majority of those guys a number of times now, so I know how I think theyтАЩre going to look to attack me,тАЭ Lyon said. тАЬThe wicket looks like itтАЩll be a typical Perth wicket, even though we are still three days out. ItтАЩs all looking like really good signs compared to Lahore, Karachi and Islamabad [Rawalpindi]. ItтАЩs going to be a bit different.тАЭ

newsArray.title: Test cricketer Asad Shafiq retires
creator: Noor Fatima
GNN
newsArray.description: While holding a press conference after the match, he said that there was no pressure to retire.
newsArray.content: Lahore: Test cricketer Asad Shafiq has announced his retirement from international and domestic cricket. According to the details, the middle-order batsman was also presented with a guard of honor by fellow players at the end of the national T20. While holding a press conference after the match, he said that there was no pressure to retire. Misbah-ul-Haq was the best captain. The right-handed batsman stated that the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) offered to join the selection committee, feeling lucky to have represented Pakistan in all three formats. Asad Shafiq represented Pakistan in all three formats, playing 77 Tests, 60 One Day Internationals (ODIs) and 10 T20Is.

newsArray.description:
Sunil Gavaskar On South Africa Cricket Board: рднрд╛рд░рдд рдФрд░ рджрдХреНрд╖рд┐рдг рдЕрдлреНрд░реАрдХрд╛ рдХреЗ рдмреАрдЪ рдЯреА20 рд╕реАрд░реАрдЬрд╝ рдХрд╛ рдкрд╣рд▓рд╛ рдореБрдХрд╛рдмрд▓рд╛ рдмрд╛рд░рд┐рд╢ рдХреЗ рдЪрд▓рддреЗ рд░рджреНрдж рд╣реЛ рдЧрдпрд╛. рджреЛрдиреЛрдВ рдХреЗ рдмреАрдЪ рдкрд╣рд▓рд╛ рдореБрдХрд╛рдмрд▓рд╛ рдмреАрддреЗ рд░рд╡рд┐рд╡рд╛рд░ (10 рджрд┐рд╕рдВрдмрд░) рдбрд░рдмрди рдореЗрдВ рдЦреЗрд▓рд╛ рдЬрд╛рдирд╛ рдерд╛, рд▓реЗрдХрд┐рди рдмрд╛рд░рд┐рд╢ рдХреЗ рдЪрд▓рддреЗ рдореБрдХрд╛рдмрд▓реЗ рдХреЗ рд▓рд┐рдП рдЯреЙрд╕ рддрдХ рди рд╣реЛ рд╕рдХрд╛. рдЕрдм рднрд╛рд░рдд рдФрд░ рджрдХреНрд╖рд┐рдг рдЕрдлреНрд░реАрдХрд╛ рдХреЗ рдмреАрдЪ рдкрд╣рд▓рд╛ рдЯреА20 рдмрд╛рд░рд┐рд╢ рдХреЗ рдХрд╛рд░рдг рд░рджреНрдж рд╣реЛрдиреЗ рдкрд░ рд╕реБрдиреАрд▓ рдЧрд╛рд╡рд╕реНрдХрд░ рднрдбрд╝рдХ рдЙрдареЗ. рдЙрдиреНрд╣реЛрдВрдиреЗ рджрдХреНрд╖рд┐рдг рдЕрдлреНрд░реАрдХрд╛ рдХреНрд░рд┐рдХреЗрдЯ рдмреЛрд░реНрдб рдХреА рдЬрдордХрд░ рдЖрд▓реЛрдЪрдирд╛ рдХреА.

newsArray.title: Yashasvi Jaiswal is an all-format prospect for India, says Sunil Gavaskar
newsArray.description: Yashasvi Jaiswal is an all-format prospect for India, says Sunil Gavaskar
newsArray.content: Listen to Story Legendary India batter Sunil Gavaskar has heaped praise on young India opener Yashasvi Jaiswal, calling him an all-format prospect. IndiaтАЩs opening match of their month-long tour to South Africa was on Sunday, December 10. Jaiswal broke into the Indian team following an impressive campaign in the 2023 Indian Premier League, where he scored 625 runs in 14 matches. Jaiswal's strike rate in 2023 was 163.61, while his strike rates in the previous two seasons were 132.99 and 148.21 in 2022 and 2021 respectively. Since making his debut for India, Jaiswal has scored 370 runs in 13 T20Is at an average of 33.63 while striking at 163.71. Incredibly, heтАЩs already scored a century and two half-centuries in T20Is for India. Not so great news from Durban as the 1st T20I has been called off due to incessant rains. тАФ BCCI (@BCCI) Speaking to Star Sports, Gavaskar said Jaiswal has got the boldness of youth, while calling him a very good talent. Jaiswal has made a great start to his India career and will be looking to cement his spot in IndiaтАЩs squad for next yearтАЩs T20 World Cup in the USA and West Indies. тАЬYashasvi Jaiswal is a very good talent and brings the left-handed factor as well. He's got the boldness of youth and freshness of not being tied down by ideas of how one should play,тАЭ said Gavaskar. He went on to call Jaiswal an all-format prospect, adding that he focuses on watching the ball and hitting it. Jaiswal has played two Test matches for India, scoring 266 runs at an average of 88.66, while hitting a century and a half-century. тАЬJust see the ball and hit the ball, this is what he does, and does it so well. He's got a century in Test cricket as well. So he is a good all-format prospect for India,тАЭ Gavaskar added. Following the wash out in Durban, India will get ready to face the Proteas in the second match of the T20I series at St George's Oval in Port Elizabeth on Tuesday, December 12.

newsArray.title: Virat Kohli-Anushka Sharma Wedding Anniversary: Fans Share Wishes for Star Couple On Their Sixth Marriage Anniversary
newsArray.description: The extremely popular couple is often referred to as 'Virushka' by fans. Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma had tied the knot way back in 2017 in Italy. See how fans have wished them on this special day.
newsArray.content: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma--two of the most popular personalities are celebrating their sixth wedding anniversary on December 11, 2023. The couple tied the knot way back in 2017 in a lavish ceremony that was held in Italy and have time and again, never stopped expressing love, respect and admiration for each other in public. The two began dating after their encounter during an advertisement in 2013. Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma also have a daughter named Vamika, who was born in 2021. As the couple enter into six years of marriage, fans have showered wishes for them on social media. 6 years of togetherness & many more to go... newsArray.title: Premier Cricket: Teague Wyllie resolute in return for Rockingham-Mandurah, leads team to win over South Perth
creator: Matt Zis
newsArray.description: Teague WyllieтАЩs first game back from injury came with exactly the innings the talented youngster wanted as he batted Rockingham-Mandurah to victory.
newsArray.content: Teague WyllieтАЩs first game back from injury was exactly the innings the talented youngster needed as he batted Rockingham-Mandurah to victory. Wyllie was left out of WAтАЩs most recent Shield contest against Queensland after injuring his arm. In his return to the crease with Premier Cricket side Rockingham-Mandurah, Wyllie made 72 not out as he anchored the MarinersтАЩ run chase from late on Saturday until they surpassed South PerthтАЩs underwhelming total of 163 the following day. But the success at Richardson Park тАФ set up by Ronan Hogarth and Aaron BurrageтАЩs three-wicket hauls on day one of the clash тАФ was far from a given as the Mariners lost seven wickets in the run chase with alarming regularity. Wyllie was more than up for the challenge, however, despite wickets falling in clumps all around him. He soaked up 229 deliveries and aside from Hogarth, who came in at No.9 and made a brisk 28n.o., was the only MarinersтАЩ batsman to pass 20. Their unbroken 66-run stand saved the day for the Mariners, who had been behind the eight-ball from the time WyllieтАЩs opening partner Mitchell Wagstaff fell for 16 close to stumps on Saturday. WagstaffтАЩs dismissal triggered a run of three wickets for just three runs and from 3-25 early on Sunday it didnтАЩt get a lot better for the visitors. The Burrage brothers fell in quick succession to be 5-58 and then 6-71 when John Sanders was trapped LBW for 8, with the Mariners neededing someone to stand up alongside their teenage tyro. Cooper Clarke-Dehring (20) тАФ and then Hogarth тАФ answered that call, working with Teague to knock off the 100-odd runs their side needed to claim the points. The MarinersтАЩ last game before the Christmas break is a one-dayer against Wanneroo at their Lark Hill home this Saturday.

newsArray.title: тАШHe is really importantтАЩ: Cripps backs favourite son in selection squeeze
creator: Jon Pierik
newsArray.description: Carlton skipper Patrick Cripps says versatility is the key for a third-generation Blue to win senior selection, coming as the superstar midfielder revealed the one word he does not want uttered this season.
newsArray.content: Carlton captain Patrick Cripps says Jack Silvagni can force his way into the BluesтАЩ best 23 next season, but that may depend on Michael VossтАЩ selection philosophy. Silvagni has signed a two-year contract extension to remain at Visy Park , his future a point of debate when ruckman-forward Tom de Koning emerged as an important figure last season, joining star tall forwards Charlie Curnow and Harry McKay, and frontline ruckman Marc Pittonet. The third-generation Blue has been used in a variety of positions through the years, most recently as an undersized back-up ruck, and again faces a major fight to earn regular senior selection. He had a knee injury late last season, which hindered his bid for selection as the Blues made a breakthrough deep finals run, falling just short of the grand final. Selection squeeze: Patrick Cripps has backed Jack Silvagni to force his way into the BluesтАЩ best 23 next season. Credit: Getty Images As the Blues confirmed a three-year sponsorship deal with Ampol on Monday, Cripps said Silvagni still had a lot to offer. тАЬHis role is really important. He plays that hybrid forward. He can play tall, he can play small, his pressure. I think his biggest one wood is the competitive energy that he has,тАЭ Cripps said. тАЬThat second ruck role that he can play as well, as an under-sized player, a bit more mobility around the ground тАУ itтАЩs all up to the coaching staff in terms of if we go two rucks, or we go the hybrid role. I just know what you are going to get when SOS plays. We all love playing with him.тАЭ Silvagni played 16 senior games last season, his last against West Coast in round 19, taking his career tally to 115 since debuting in 2016. The Blues had a strong training session on Monday, Silvagni included, as they aim to deliver the clubтАЩs first grand-final appearance since 1999. Cripps said the clubтАЩs new faces had impressed in the first phase of the pre-season campaign. тАЬThe new boys, Ashton [Moir], Billy [Wilson], Matty [Carroll], they have all fitted in really well and had a crack. Ashton and Billy have done most of the sessions, thatтАЩs all you can ask,тАЭ he said. Loading Voss spoke last week about the heightened expectations the Blues face this season. However, Cripps, 28, said there was one word he did not want uttered in a year when the Blues will be in the spotlight, having become a prime-time favourite of host broadcasters. тАЬI actually hate the word expectations, because you are trying to predict something that hasnтАЩt happened yet,тАЭ Cripps, having averaged almost 25 disposals in 24 games last year, said. тАЬI think we learnt a really hard lesson last year, and I felt like the group lost their confidence in the middle part. I think through that adversity we know what we can focus on to make us a good side тАж the controllables. тАЬThe external, it doesnтАЩt actually really matter. What really matters is what we value internally. We talk about a lot of things without the ball. тАЬThe one thing we really focused on in that back half of the year was how can we bring a lot of joy and fun around the club. ThatтАЩs what I feel like last year, as hard as it was, we learnt a really good lesson about what is important to us. I think thatтАЩs what gives me a lot of confidence going into this pre-season, and also the season тАУ we know what makes us a good side.тАЭ The Blues open the new season against the Lions in Brisbane on March 8. newsArray.title: тАШIтАЩve got no dramasтАЩ: Lyon extends olive branch to Johnson
creator: Daniel Brettig
newsArray.description: Nathan Lyon has extended his hand to Mitchell Johnson ahead of the Perth Test against Pakistan, declaring their bond from the 2013-14 Ashes series is unbroken
newsArray.content: Perth: Nathan Lyon has extended his hand to Mitchell Johnson ahead of the Perth Test against Pakistan, declaring their bond from the 2013-14 Ashes series is unbroken despite the former spearheadтАЩs fiery recent criticism of the Australian team. Still early in his Test career when Johnson rattled England in a 5-0 whitewash , Lyon has since grown into an integral member of the national side and now sits on the cusp of becoming only the third Australian to take 500 Test wickets. Mitchell Johnson celebrates with Nathan Lyon after Johnson threw down the stumps to run out Joe Root at the MCG in 2013. Credit: Ken Irwin He is a strong chance to take the four wickets he needs at Perth Stadium starting on Thursday, given that nowhere else in Australia has been more helpful to his art - Lyon has plucked 22 wickets at 18.45 in three Tests at the ground, striking every 42.4 deliveries. And Lyon has no intention of brushing Johnson if they cross paths during Test week, with the left-armer and now commentator to be part of the Triple M team for the match . тАЬIf heтАЩs around the ground IтАЩll say hello to him, IтАЩve got no dramas with saying hello,тАЭ Lyon said. тАЬHe was pretty incredible in that 2013-14 Ashes, and IтАЩve got some very fond memories of it, thatтАЩs for sure. тАЬI feel like this stadium is word class and the facilities weтАЩve had out here have been really exciting to bowl on and be a part of a strong bowling group. тАЬI like playing my role here, I enjoy bowling here, thereтАЩs nice bounce, a bit of spin there on offer as well, so all in all a nice place to bowl.тАЬ Nevertheless, Lyon politely rejected the notion that the team led by Pat Cummins needed to move into regeneration mode this summer, the subject of JohnsonтАЩs most recent column. WA speedster Lance Morris is likely to remain in the wings as Cummins, Mitch Starc and Josh Hazlewood form the frontline pace trio, with Lyon to replace Todd Murphy in the XI that finished the Ashes. тАЬYou look at the squad weтАЩve got at the moment, yes weтАЩve played a lot of cricket together but weтАЩve won a lot of games together as well,тАЭ he said. тАЬThen you look at the World Cup guys and what theyтАЩve been able to win as a collective, I feel like thatтАЩs incredibly important. тАЬThis is AustraliaтАЩs cricket team and in my eyes you need to pick the best available 11 and I believe that is what the selectors are doing.тАЬ Rejuvenated after missing three Ashes Tests due to a badly torn calf, Lyon is enthused by the prospect of joining Shane Warne and Glenn McGrath in the rarified air of 500-plus Test victims, and he refused to rule out challenging their tallies by the time he finished up. тАЬIтАЩm not putting a number on it,тАЭ Lyon said. тАЬI want to play cricket for as long as I can. I didnтАЩt win in India and I havenтАЩt won in England, and itтАЩs two places I want to do. I feel like thereтАЩs a passion there to keep going - IтАЩm definitely not putting a line through where I can get to. тАЬItтАЩs something IтАЩm extremely proud of and when you look at it youтАЩre slowly creeping your way up on two Australian greats who are the only two guys who have taken over 500 wickets for Australia. ItтАЩs pretty amazing when you potentially see your name up alongside those guys.тАЭ Mitchell Johnson wrestles with Nathan Lyon during training ahead of the 2015 Perth Test. Credit: Paul Kane Lyon took note of how PakistanтАЩs captain Shan Masood and other touring batters aimed to get after the spin of his understudy Todd Murphy in Canberra, albeit in slow and low conditions much closer in character to Pakistan than Perth. тАЬI did watch that, but looking at their batting lineup IтАЩve played against the majority of those guys a number of times now, so I know how I think theyтАЩre going to look to attack me,тАЭ Lyon said. тАЬThe wicket looks like itтАЩll be a typical Perth wicket, even though we are still three days out. ItтАЩs all looking like really good signs compared to Lahore, Karachi and Islamabad [Rawalpindi]. ItтАЩs going to be a bit different.тАЭ

newsArray.title: Test cricketer Asad Shafiq retires
creator: Noor Fatima
GNN
newsArray.description: While holding a press conference after the match, he said that there was no pressure to retire.
newsArray.content: Lahore: Test cricketer Asad Shafiq has announced his retirement from international and domestic cricket. According to the details, the middle-order batsman was also presented with a guard of honor by fellow players at the end of the national T20. While holding a press conference after the match, he said that there was no pressure to retire. Misbah-ul-Haq was the best captain. The right-handed batsman stated that the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) offered to join the selection committee, feeling lucky to have represented Pakistan in all three formats. Asad Shafiq represented Pakistan in all three formats, playing 77 Tests, 60 One Day Internationals (ODIs) and 10 T20Is.

newsArray.description:
Sunil Gavaskar On South Africa Cricket Board: рднрд╛рд░рдд рдФрд░ рджрдХреНрд╖рд┐рдг рдЕрдлреНрд░реАрдХрд╛ рдХреЗ рдмреАрдЪ рдЯреА20 рд╕реАрд░реАрдЬрд╝ рдХрд╛ рдкрд╣рд▓рд╛ рдореБрдХрд╛рдмрд▓рд╛ рдмрд╛рд░рд┐рд╢ рдХреЗ рдЪрд▓рддреЗ рд░рджреНрдж рд╣реЛ рдЧрдпрд╛. рджреЛрдиреЛрдВ рдХреЗ рдмреАрдЪ рдкрд╣рд▓рд╛ рдореБрдХрд╛рдмрд▓рд╛ рдмреАрддреЗ рд░рд╡рд┐рд╡рд╛рд░ (10 рджрд┐рд╕рдВрдмрд░) рдбрд░рдмрди рдореЗрдВ рдЦреЗрд▓рд╛ рдЬрд╛рдирд╛ рдерд╛, рд▓реЗрдХрд┐рди рдмрд╛рд░рд┐рд╢ рдХреЗ рдЪрд▓рддреЗ рдореБрдХрд╛рдмрд▓реЗ рдХреЗ рд▓рд┐рдП рдЯреЙрд╕ рддрдХ рди рд╣реЛ рд╕рдХрд╛. рдЕрдм рднрд╛рд░рдд рдФрд░ рджрдХреНрд╖рд┐рдг рдЕрдлреНрд░реАрдХрд╛ рдХреЗ рдмреАрдЪ рдкрд╣рд▓рд╛ рдЯреА20 рдмрд╛рд░рд┐рд╢ рдХреЗ рдХрд╛рд░рдг рд░рджреНрдж рд╣реЛрдиреЗ рдкрд░ рд╕реБрдиреАрд▓ рдЧрд╛рд╡рд╕реНрдХрд░ рднрдбрд╝рдХ рдЙрдареЗ. рдЙрдиреНрд╣реЛрдВрдиреЗ рджрдХреНрд╖рд┐рдг рдЕрдлреНрд░реАрдХрд╛ рдХреНрд░рд┐рдХреЗрдЯ рдмреЛрд░реНрдб рдХреА рдЬрдордХрд░ рдЖрд▓реЛрдЪрдирд╛ рдХреА.

newsArray.title: Yashasvi Jaiswal is an all-format prospect for India, says Sunil Gavaskar
newsArray.description: Yashasvi Jaiswal is an all-format prospect for India, says Sunil Gavaskar
newsArray.content: Listen to Story Legendary India batter Sunil Gavaskar has heaped praise on young India opener Yashasvi Jaiswal, calling him an all-format prospect. IndiaтАЩs opening match of their month-long tour to South Africa was on Sunday, December 10. Jaiswal broke into the Indian team following an impressive campaign in the 2023 Indian Premier League, where he scored 625 runs in 14 matches. Jaiswal's strike rate in 2023 was 163.61, while his strike rates in the previous two seasons were 132.99 and 148.21 in 2022 and 2021 respectively. Since making his debut for India, Jaiswal has scored 370 runs in 13 T20Is at an average of 33.63 while striking at 163.71. Incredibly, heтАЩs already scored a century and two half-centuries in T20Is for India. Not so great news from Durban as the 1st T20I has been called off due to incessant rains. тАФ BCCI (@BCCI) Speaking to Star Sports, Gavaskar said Jaiswal has got the boldness of youth, while calling him a very good talent. Jaiswal has made a great start to his India career and will be looking to cement his spot in IndiaтАЩs squad for next yearтАЩs T20 World Cup in the USA and West Indies. тАЬYashasvi Jaiswal is a very good talent and brings the left-handed factor as well. He's got the boldness of youth and freshness of not being tied down by ideas of how one should play,тАЭ said Gavaskar. He went on to call Jaiswal an all-format prospect, adding that he focuses on watching the ball and hitting it. Jaiswal has played two Test matches for India, scoring 266 runs at an average of 88.66, while hitting a century and a half-century. тАЬJust see the ball and hit the ball, this is what he does, and does it so well. He's got a century in Test cricket as well. So he is a good all-format prospect for India,тАЭ Gavaskar added. Following the wash out in Durban, India will get ready to face the Proteas in the second match of the T20I series at St George's Oval in Port Elizabeth on Tuesday, December 12.

newsArray.title: Virat Kohli-Anushka Sharma Wedding Anniversary: Fans Share Wishes for Star Couple On Their Sixth Marriage Anniversary
newsArray.description: The extremely popular couple is often referred to as 'Virushka' by fans. Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma had tied the knot way back in 2017 in Italy. See how fans have wished them on this special day.
newsArray.content: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma--two of the most popular personalities are celebrating their sixth wedding anniversary on December 11, 2023. The couple tied the knot way back in 2017 in a lavish ceremony that was held in Italy and have time and again, never stopped expressing love, respect and admiration for each other in public. The two began dating after their encounter during an advertisement in 2013. Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma also have a daughter named Vamika, who was born in 2021. As the couple enter into six years of marriage, fans have showered wishes for them on social media. 6 years of togetherness & many more to go... newsArray.title: Premier Cricket: Teague Wyllie resolute in return for Rockingham-Mandurah, leads team to win over South Perth
creator: Matt Zis
newsArray.description: Teague WyllieтАЩs first game back from injury came with exactly the innings the talented youngster wanted as he batted Rockingham-Mandurah to victory.
newsArray.content: Teague WyllieтАЩs first game back from injury was exactly the innings the talented youngster needed as he batted Rockingham-Mandurah to victory. Wyllie was left out of WAтАЩs most recent Shield contest against Queensland after injuring his arm. In his return to the crease with Premier Cricket side Rockingham-Mandurah, Wyllie made 72 not out as he anchored the MarinersтАЩ run chase from late on Saturday until they surpassed South PerthтАЩs underwhelming total of 163 the following day. But the success at Richardson Park тАФ set up by Ronan Hogarth and Aaron BurrageтАЩs three-wicket hauls on day one of the clash тАФ was far from a given as the Mariners lost seven wickets in the run chase with alarming regularity. Wyllie was more than up for the challenge, however, despite wickets falling in clumps all around him. He soaked up 229 deliveries and aside from Hogarth, who came in at No.9 and made a brisk 28n.o., was the only MarinersтАЩ batsman to pass 20. Their unbroken 66-run stand saved the day for the Mariners, who had been behind the eight-ball from the time WyllieтАЩs opening partner Mitchell Wagstaff fell for 16 close to stumps on Saturday. WagstaffтАЩs dismissal triggered a run of three wickets for just three runs and from 3-25 early on Sunday it didnтАЩt get a lot better for the visitors. The Burrage brothers fell in quick succession to be 5-58 and then 6-71 when John Sanders was trapped LBW for 8, with the Mariners neededing someone to stand up alongside their teenage tyro. Cooper Clarke-Dehring (20) тАФ and then Hogarth тАФ answered that call, working with Teague to knock off the 100-odd runs their side needed to claim the points. The MarinersтАЩ last game before the Christmas break is a one-dayer against Wanneroo at their Lark Hill home this Saturday.

newsArray.title: тАШHe is really importantтАЩ: Cripps backs favourite son in selection squeeze
creator: Jon Pierik
newsArray.description: Carlton skipper Patrick Cripps says versatility is the key for a third-generation Blue to win senior selection, coming as the superstar midfielder revealed the one word he does not want uttered this season.
newsArray.content: Carlton captain Patrick Cripps says Jack Silvagni can force his way into the BluesтАЩ best 23 next season, but that may depend on Michael VossтАЩ selection philosophy. Silvagni has signed a two-year contract extension to remain at Visy Park , his future a point of debate when ruckman-forward Tom de Koning emerged as an important figure last season, joining star tall forwards Charlie Curnow and Harry McKay, and frontline ruckman Marc Pittonet. The third-generation Blue has been used in a variety of positions through the years, most recently as an undersized back-up ruck, and again faces a major fight to earn regular senior selection. He had a knee injury late last season, which hindered his bid for selection as the Blues made a breakthrough deep finals run, falling just short of the grand final. Selection squeeze: Patrick Cripps has backed Jack Silvagni to force his way into the BluesтАЩ best 23 next season. Credit: Getty Images As the Blues confirmed a three-year sponsorship deal with Ampol on Monday, Cripps said Silvagni still had a lot to offer. тАЬHis role is really important. He plays that hybrid forward. He can play tall, he can play small, his pressure. I think his biggest one wood is the competitive energy that he has,тАЭ Cripps said. тАЬThat second ruck role that he can play as well, as an under-sized player, a bit more mobility around the ground тАУ itтАЩs all up to the coaching staff in terms of if we go two rucks, or we go the hybrid role. I just know what you are going to get when SOS plays. We all love playing with him.тАЭ Silvagni played 16 senior games last season, his last against West Coast in round 19, taking his career tally to 115 since debuting in 2016.
